chat_history.message:
Hello,

My product iPhone 13 Pro has the above problem:

I've bought a phone in very good condition for the second time (!!!) now. Extra 'very good' because it's important to me to have a scratch-free display. Both times I've purchased a device with visible scratches on the display. How can this be that you always sell devices in a much worse condition than described? As seen on the pictures, there is damage on the display, how do you justify calling the condition 'Very good'?!

Thank you for your help,

Dear ecomobile

The customer sends the device for replacement, as there must be no scratches on the display 

Regards,
Ermelinda from the Back Care Team

Dear Backcare,

We await the arrival of the parcel. Thank you.

Regards,
AS

Hello ecomobile,

You have received the product for 11.06.24. The delay to repair or exchange the product is 3 days for technical issue. Without answer with a valid tracking link before the 14.06.24 we will refund the customer.

Thank you for understanding,
Ermelinda from Back Market

Dear Backcare,

Unfortunately, we do not have any available stocks for replacement. Instead, we have refunded the customer.

Regards,
JH
